Index » ThreeDNavController

Class: ThreeDNavController

Defined in: coffee/ThreeDNavController.coffee

Overview

Class to calculate changes in camera position and orientation. Intended as a testable back-end to a thin-but-difficult-to-test set of ui elements and callbacks.

Instance Method Summary

  • # (Object) normalizeMouseTravel(width, height, start, end)

    convert mouse travel into a percentage of the screen or element width and height; using the width and height as normalized units ensures that resizing the window or element doesn't mess up navigation.
  • # (object) calculateRotationVector(normalizedTravel, zoom, zeroZoomRotation = (Math.PI * 2), zoomFactor = 1) Calculates how much pitch and yaw is called for, based on the number of widths / heights moved by the mouse and the zoom.
  • # (void) clampAngle0_2PI(theta) sets angle to angle mod 2pi
  • # (void) mouseXYToCameraRotation(mouseDX, mouseDY, yaw, radiansPerFrameUnit) updates the rotation submatrix of the provided matrix based on mouse movement.
  • # (void) pitchRotationAxis(yaw) As the yaw changes, so does the axis through the xy plane about which pitch should rotate.

Instance Method Details

# (Object) normalizeMouseTravel(width, height, start, end)

convert mouse travel into a percentage of the screen or element width and height; using the width and height as normalized units ensures that resizing the window or element doesn't mess up navigation. Note that this function can return x and y values greater than 1.

Parameters:

  • width ( Number ) — width of situationally-appropriate container
  • height ( Number ) — height of situationally-appropriate container
  • start ( Object ) — x: {Number, y: Number}
  • end ( Object ) — x: {Number, y: Number}

Returns:

  • ( Object ) — {x: Number, y: Number} -- units are width and height

# (object) calculateRotationVector(normalizedTravel, zoom, zeroZoomRotation = (Math.PI * 2), zoomFactor = 1)

Calculates how much pitch and yaw is called for, based on the number of widths / heights moved by the mouse and the zoom.

Parameters:

  • normalizedTravel ( Object ) — {x: Number, y: Number} -- units are width and height
  • zoom ( Number ) — distance between camera and focal point
  • zeroZoomRotation ( Number ) — radians rotated per element-worth of mouse movement when zoom is 0. Defaults to 2 * pi.
  • zoomFactor ( number ) — : optional argument to scale the zoom. Defaults to 1

Returns:

  • ( object ) — {pitch: Number, yaw: Number}

# (void) clampAngle0_2PI(theta)

sets angle to angle mod 2pi

Parameters:

  • theta ( Number ) — radians

# (void) mouseXYToCameraRotation(mouseDX, mouseDY, yaw, radiansPerFrameUnit)

updates the rotation submatrix of the provided matrix based on mouse movement.

Parameters:

  • mouseDX ( Number ) — normalized units
  • mouseDY ( Number ) — normalized units
  • yaw ( Number ) — radians
  • radiansPerFrameUnit ( Number )

# (void) pitchRotationAxis(yaw)

As the yaw changes, so does the axis through the xy plane about which pitch should rotate. This takes the yaw and returns that axis

Parameters:

  • yaw ( Number ) — radians.
